text:
What's going on Food Tube it's Tim the Human
here AKA the Vegan Prince back once again

these are my vegan winter rolls now this is
a classic twist on the Vietnamese suma rolls

I'm switching up the fillings to match the
season there's lovely fruit flavours and a

sweet and sour tone, these are packed with
flavour and nutrition, this recipe serves

6 first off you wanna put a pot of water on
the boil and grab your veg taking one spring

onion one chili and some pickled ginger now
we're gonna make the sauce first off we're

gonna finely shop the veg I like heat so I'm
gonna leave the seeds in my chili but if you're

sensitive to that you might wanna cut it in
half and scrape the seeds out first my chopping

technique's a little sloppy I get the job
done just like you can too finely chop it

as small as you can that's about a tablespoon
of pickled ginger it's fresh, it's colourful

we've got four tablespoons sweet chili sauce
nice and sticky sweetens it up two teaspoons

of sesame oil, two teaspoons of low salt soy
sauce next up juice of two limes loosen them

up so the juice is ready to come out imagine
the tang in that, lime ginger and chili and

finally one tablespoon of water now you wanna
just stir that all up mix it in together smelling

great tastes bang on the sauce to one side
and now we're gonna get on cooking our noodles

now you wanna boil the noodles you want about
100 grams, two nests there, while they're

boiling we're gonna chop up some more veg
take your mixing bowl first off one of my

favourite vegetables real super food, kale,
you want about 75 grams of that, first off

you wanna chop off the stalks cos they're
gonna poke through the rice paper if you leave

them on, you can chew on them if you want,
you wanna get it really finely chopped cos

it's gotta fit into a roll, into the bowl
next up let's take one carrot, peel the carrot,

once you've peeled the carrot you're gonna
cut it into battons now you've chopped up

the carrot batons your wanna check the noodles,
mine are done now so we're gonna drain them

off and put them to one side you leave that
to cool down while you continue with the vegetable

mixing bowl we're gonna add 50 grams of bean
sprouts in they go and we're gonna chop up

some more ginger another tablespoon finely
sliced like before ginger's in the bowl take

your noodles gonna pop them in too now one
of my favourite fruits one whole pomegranate

cutting down the middle, look at that deep
reds here's a technique I learnt from Food

Tube there we go firing seeds in all directions,
look at the colours look what the pomegranates

done to those noodles painted them beautifully
pink great touch to these winter rolls next

up I'm gonna add a couple of herbs we've got
some mint and some coriander pick about four

of each you just want to tear the leaves off
get involved nice hands on such a different

smell to everything else that's going on just
tear them up so they'll nice little pockets

of flavour, not too intense, not too small
next we're gonna drizzle some sesame seed

oil, about a tablespoon worth and we're gonna
mix it all up, get my hands involved bring

that kale back up from the bottom season the
veg, we've got that kale really love that

kale such a great addition just to keep everything
super healthy again super healthy with the

pomegranate seeds finish mixing that through
and now we're gonna put that to one side while

we start on our rice papers, take your rice
paper and dip it in a bowl of warm water for

ten seconds just so it softens up take it
outlet it dry on some kitchen roll this is

it dry, nice and sticky and then add the filling
take a handful of veg and noodles roll over

the end just like a burrito nice chunky parcel
I can't wait to try that there we have it

guys winter roll, look at the great purple
noodles in there you've got the kale the carrot

the mint the coriander pomegranate seeds looking
beautiful and that sauce you make earlier

look at that delicious before we go guys if
you want to see more of my vegan recipes click

right here if you want to check out my channel
for more vegan advice, fitness, health, active

lifestyle stuff check that link right here,
if you've ever made a recipe like this or

you've got your own spin on it leave us a
comment below and as always if you like the

video give us a like it's Food Tube baby it's
all love in here, until next time!
